body: Thanks for the quick response @jsumners. I think it would be worth including your snippet in the docs to avoid people like me looking for a quick fix, asking silly questions. ;-)
PRs for improved documentation are always welcome.
Maybe we should just ship this? I don't remember why we shouldn't.

I could publish a plugin if that helps? Otherwise I could just add the snippet to the docs, but most people would abstract that away into a plugin anyway.

Its great that everything is low level and can be customised but something like this may give the wrong impression to new users early on during evaluation that it is just harder to use than you would expect, or worse, that it is unfinished and may raise unfounded concerns about other, more advanced aspects of Fastify.
Isn't a plugin somewhat overkill for this? ü§î

Yes, it is overkill, but convenient for new users not expecting to write any custom code to handle simple plain text. I've already written a local plugin adapted from fastify-formBody, so I could publish that unless there are any objections?

@lfurzewaddock I agree with you so I think that we should bake this into the core for convenience, since it's very basic, instead of a plugin. Not sure if this was discussed before, I personally expect the framework to come with batteries-included for these kind of things.

@fastify/fastify  WDYT ?

I'm +1 on adding this to core.

@delvedor?
@lfurzewaddock would you like to send a PR for this?
